title: After installing Windows 10, League client won't run.
body:
So I upgraded to Windows 10 yesterday, and after I installed it, I couldn't run the League of Legends client. I open it, then it stops working. It says another instance of the launcher is running and asks me if I want to terminate it. It doesn't proceed past that step. I click "okay", and then the client closes. When I check the task manager after, "LoL Patcher (32 bit)", "PVP.net Patcher Kernel (32 bit)", and "Riot Client Patcher (32 bit)" are all still running in the background. Even after I end the tasks and when I try to open the League client, the same problem occurs. In addition, League of Legends is listed as unavailable for some reason in Settings->System->Apps and features.

http://imgur.com/a/ln2wX
http://imgur.com/a/MCui6

I have also tried the following options:
-reinstalled
-ran as administrator
-deleted the two files named "S_OK" and "release manifest" in the "release" folder.
-deleted the "logs", "META-INF", "lol.properties", and "LoLClient.exe" in the "deploy" folder.

Please help.

replies.body: The Fix is to simply run as admin even if you are admin you still need to right click - run as admin. At least it was for me are 3 others... let me know
I ran as admin before (right-click), and I tried it again, but it still doesn't work. :/

OH It's this one. Yes I believe this is exactly what happened to my roomate and after hours of searching online and asking Rito they didn't have an answer (he eventually sent me a text asking me if I had any ideas). He had also upgraded to Windows 10 from 7 and had this exactly happen. If I remember correctly, rito can correct me if I'm wrong and has a simpler answer, you need to uninstall league, open File Explorer and go to your profile (C:\Users\profile_name), allow yourself to view hidden folders (sorry can't remember and not on my computer to find out on for Windows 10) AppData, Then I think It's in Local or LocalLow (maybe both)??? you need to delete the files left over that are related to League of legends, LOL, Riot Games (wish I could provide the exact path but I'm at work with no computer with League installed). Then re-install league and it should work - maybe POROCLES can assist where the file are in AppData.


Uninstall League
C:\Users\profile_name
AppData - Will have to enable invisible folders
Local or LocalLow or Roaming - Locate files/folders related to league (LOL_Client/League of Legends/Riot_Games/etc.) and delete these lingering files
Install League of Legends


*EDITED TO INCLUDE ROAMING FOLDER IN CASE OTHERS HAVE THIS ISSUE

After I uninstalled League, I tried to find any remaining LoL files in Local and LocalLow, but there weren't any lingering files/folders in there. There are, however, Riot Games folders in C:\Users\Owner\AppData\Roaming and in C:\ProgramData. There are also League of Legends folders in C:\Users\Owner\AppData\Roaming\Riot Games. Should I delete these folders?
If you are sure they are related to rito games/league/lol client yes. You uninstalled the game so deleting the files won't do anything because the games gone anyways.
Oh the actual folder is riot games haha missed that part, yes, delete
Woooooooooo that worked! Thank you very much!

Glad I could help. My roommate struggled with that by himself for days and Rito didn't have a solution. That issue has come back for him though unfortunately...twice in the last 8 months. Guess it's not a permanent fix. I don't actually work for Riot so I couldn't tell you the cause or how to prevent it; this is pretty much band-aid for now (maybe yours will be permanent, lets hope). Windows 10 is considered "new" still I guess so it'll probably be patched one day.
It was fine the day before on Windows 7.
Make sure your anti-virus software is not blocking your client from working as well. Sometimes, antivirus software like AVG or Avast can delete suspicious files

It sounds like a setting with your OS might be preventing the game from launching properly, but I can't say for sure.  Deleting files and folders would cause more issues than solve them, so there may be other problems.  Please reach out to us in a [ticket submission](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can help with your specific issue individually.  We'll respond to your ticket asap!
